Package it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.policies

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ExplicitInputPolicy<E,D>
    Defines the interface for policies that accept explicit input
    ImplicitAndExplicitPolicy<I,E,D>
    Identifies policies that depend on implicit and explicit parameters
    ImplicitButNotExplicitPolicy<I,D>
    Identifies policies that depend on the implicit input and do NOT depend on the explicit input
    ImplicitInputPolicy<I>
    Identifies a policy that depends only on implicit input, i.e. the input data that is set into the policy object, at object instantiation time and at anytime during the program execution, except at decision invocation time.
    InputAndStatePolicy<S>
    Identifies a policy that depends on input parameters and internal state
    InputPolicy
    Identifies a policy that depend on input parameters
    Policy
    Defines the identifier for decision policies within jEQN simulation components
    StatePolicy<S>
    Identifies a decision policy that depends on the internal state
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CombinedPolicy<E,D1,D2>
    Concatenates two decision policies.
    ConditionBasedPolicy<I,E,S,D>
    Provides the basic schema for policies that are defined depending on a condition.
    ExplicitInputOnlyDependentPolicy<E,D>
    Provides the basic schema for policies that depend only on explicit input
    FixedDecisionPolicy<D>
    Defines a policy dependent on a constant state
    ImplicitAndExplicitInputAndStateDependentPolicy<I,E,S,D>
    Provides the basic schema for policies that have implicit and explicit input and that have an internal state
    ImplicitAndExplicitInputDependentPolicy<I,E,D>
    Provides the basic schema for implicit and explicit input dependent policies
    ImplicitButNotEsplicitMaskingStateOnlyDependentPolicy<S,D>
    Defines a mask to plug policies within jEQN simulation components
    ImplicitButNotExplicitInputAndStateDependentPolicy<I,S,D>
    Identifies policies that depend on the internal state besides from implicit and explicit input
    ImplicitButNotExplicitInputOnlyDependentPolicy<I,D>
    Identifies policies that depend ONLY on the implicit and explicit input
    InterleavedPolicy<E,D>
    Defines a policy based on an interleave set of policy streams.
    MapImplicitAndExplicitInputDependentPolicy<E,D>
    Reverse the hierarchical tree of the policy classification to enable the transparent deployment of all types of policies.
    ObjectSequencePolicy<D>
    Defines a State only policy that consists of a predetermined sequence of states, each identified as Object instance.
    StateOnlyDependentPolicy<S,D>
    Identifies a decision policy that depends only on the internal state
